snippet: Many demonstrators say they have shrugged off guidance from elders in the African-American establishment, and even the Brown family, which has repeatedly pleaded for calm.
abstract: Protests over police shooting of black teenager Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo, persist, largely splitting into groups of peaceful demonstrators and others who are carrying out acts of violence and looting; clergymen, civil rights leaders and African American elders express frustration at their inability to guide younger, violent protesters, with some citing a generational divide.
lead_paragraph: Many demonstrators say they have shrugged off guidance from elders in the African-American establishment, and even the Brown family, which has repeatedly pleaded for calm.

headline.main: Lack of Leadership and a Generational Split Hinder Protests in Ferguson
headline.print_headline: Lack of Leadership and a Generational Split Hinder Protests in Ferguson
